title: (10200) Trujillo - 33D Carretera de Plasencia
description: Open place with picnic tables nearby. Possibility of staying overnight.

title: (10200) Trujillo - 0 Avenida Reina María Cristina
description: Parking for the day to visit the castle and the site with waste disposal

title: (10200) Trujillo - 5 Calle Cordel de Santa Catalina
title_short: (10200) Trujillo - 5 Calle Cordel de Santa Catalina
description: Next to the bullring we have found this site. there was room in the square but it was sloping . Peaceful place. bar next door

title: (10200) Trujillo - 3 Calle Depósito
description: Next to Plaza Toros, a very quiet place to spend the night, we slept very well. The black water outlet does not have its own faucet, please do not use the clean water faucet. And very close to the center to visit the city. Thank you Trujillo for having such a site.

title: (10200) Trujillo - 3 Travesía Ramón y Cajal
description: Parking area very quiet day and night, without services.

title: (10200) Trujillo - 5 Plaza Almagro
description: Quiet place to rest. That if area of many trees with many birds. Not recommended when trees are not pruned by large numbers of birds

title: (10290) Trujillo - Unnamed Road
description: Surprisingly enough: at the end of a dead end. in the middle of the fields. But probably at the place of the extension of the industrial zone which is not very far. Calm.

title: (10200) Trujillo - km 245 A-5
description: Petrol station and restaurant with parking lot open 24h.

title: (10270) La Cumbre - 100 Avenida de la Constitución
title_short: (10270) La Cumbre - 100 Avenida de la Constitución
description: In a rural environment near the pool, shops, bars. Feast of the Patron Saint on August 15 on the square, every day events. Parties 20,21 and 22 do not miss it. Never seen anyone in cars and have a good time guaranteed.

title: (10291) - 25 Calle Alvarado
description: Huge slightly sloping parking with space for 20-25 caravans. Today the restaurant is abandoned and although it is close to the road, it does not have much traffic. the old parking lot of the place is very wide surrounded by field and semi-flat. Good to spend a night near Monfragüe

title: (10290) Trujillo - 240 Paseo de Extremadura
description: Repsol station. There are motorhome services, to empty gray and black, also to wash large ac. Quiet place to spend a night. The water does not currently work.

title: (10291) La Aldea del Obispo -
description: We spent one night here. Cars pass occasionally in the evening and in the morning, but without any problems. Furthermore, only sounds of cattle and birds can be heard. An area where you can find and watch many species of birds. There are no amenities. Not far from the village of La Aldea del Obispo.

title: (10270) La Cumbre - CC-57.1
description: Place in the countryside near a very quiet road. Sunset and beautiful sunrise!

title: (10290) Trujillo - Paseo de Extremadura
description: Rest area on the road. Clean and quiet area to rest and eat. Bench area for outdoor dining. Nice views of the pasture.

title: (10260) Santa Cruz de la Sierra - CC-24.1
title_short: (10260) Santa Cruz de la Sierra - CC-24.1
description: Quiet place for the night there are no services but it is free is a public parking. In summer it is the parking of the municipal swimming pool.The municipal swimming pool closes at 8:30 p.m. In the town square there is a churreria for breakfast, it is not easy to see it but ask for it, they also make toasts, the place is open at 8 in the morning and also usually sells bread from the village baker.In front of it there is a bar with a terrace where you can have lunch and dinner

title: (10290) Trujillo - Carretera de Extremadura
description: Highway rest area

title: (10291) La Aldea del Obispo - EX-208
description: Quiet place in the nature with picnic table, located directly on the road (now and then a car passes by) but no direct view of the road. Just over 5km to the next village with supermarket and gas station (water). Perfect for a night ..

title: (10290) Trujillo - EX-208
description: Picnic area with spectacular views. It has nothing but picnic tables, but the setting is idyllic and is on the side of the road along the Tozo River. Quiet night. You can spend the night when you are outside the PN Monfragüe

title: (10240) Conquista de la Sierra - 22 Calle Segunda
title_short: (10240) Conquista de la Sierra - 22 Calle Segunda
description: 4 shaded picnic tables and drinking fountain on the edge of the pretty village of Conquista de la Sierra.

title: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - CC-99.1
description: Small parking area by bridge, visited by day but quiet at night, room for 2, beautiful

title: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - 7A Avenida España
title_short: (10198) Santa Marta de Magasca - 7A Avenida España
description: Area with picnic area and exercise machines. A little neglected the latter. Nice for a stop to coner / rest, maybe even stay overnight. There is hardly any passing of cars or noise.

title: (10252) Torrecillas de la Tiesa - N-V
description: Beneath a 14th century bridge directly next to a river. No noise from the nearby highway and very little traffic at night on the N-V. No services.

title: (10188) Botija - Unnamed Road
description: Lovely landscape of granite and oaks. Spacious parking. Guided tours can be arranged by calling the Botija Town Hall. It is worth it for the elderly and children. Overnight one night in Easter and without problems. We only heard visitors who came to the site in the morning.

title: (10380) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: At the foot of the bridge on Rio Almonte. About twenty km from the Monfrague National Park. Slope access but short slope. Can be difficult for large motorhomes, no problem with a van. Quiet, little passage on the road at night. We stayed 2 nights without problem.

title: (10130) Zorita - EX-208
description: Very quiet and shady place, fountain with chilled ice water never seen Very beautiful open church worth seeing. a donation is appreciated

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Old rest area. Have chosen this place because the down spot on the road is only accessible by a path a little chaotic.

name: La Finca Solidaria
title: (10251) La Finca Solidaria
description:
Nice welcome by a dynamic young couple in full development of their educational farm and rural tourism project "La finca solidaria"
They speak French and Spanish, a little English and German.
Facilities: sink, gas stove in a shelter furnished with tables and chairs, shower and dry toilet.
Dogs and cats roam free on a large plot of land. There are also donkeys, goats, sheep and chickens.
Pitches available for motorhome, caravan, van, tent, etc.
Gate width: 3.00 m
Warning: Do not take the path facing the cemetery which is very narrow surrounded by stone walls. Take the dirt road located just above, where there is a green agricultural building.
Do not hesitate to call if in doubt.

title: (10263) Villamesías - 36 Paseo de la Constitucion
description: Picnic area, with table and games for children, ideal lunch stop.

title: (10130) Zorita - 10 Calle Cordel de Merinas
description: On the outskirts of Zorita on the village pond under eucalyptus trees located place, partly sunny partly attached to the ground. Right next to it is a restaurant. Good for a night.

title: (10130) Zorita - 26 Calle Acceso C Salud
description: A very wide street in Zorita, quiet and with beautiful views.

title: (10189) Zarza de Montánchez -
description: Zarza de Montanchez. Place in grass next to the sports center with good access, even for large AC. Ideal place to visit the neighboring oak of La Terrona, considered the oldest of the Iberian Peninsula.

title: (10135) Alcollarín - Calle la Palma
description: Super quiet parking to spend the night at the foot of the Alcollarín reservoir. A few meters from the parking you have a summer bar and well-prepared public toilets. With access ramps to the reservoir for boats and beach for bathing. around the reservoir you have many routes to walk. The town has a well-supplied grocery store on the road that crosses the town (Tío Diego grocery store). No noise or disturbance, ideal to spend 2-3 days doing sports and resting. Nearby you have many interesting towns to visit. Apart from the parking you have more areas to stay to sleep, a lot of space available.

name: Camping Las Grullas
title: (10185) Camping Las Grullas
description: Campsite Las Grullas. Naturist campsite. Excellent location, very peaceful and private. Thirty spaces and a chalet for rent. Electricity included. Water included and drinkable. Swimming pool and free wifi. Excellent facilities, well built and very clean. Very friendly owners who speak several European languages.

title: (10251) Aldeacentenera - Unnamed Road
description: Peaceful at the edge of the elongated Rio. perfect for a night and ornithological.

name: Área de Autocaravanas Deleitosa
title: (10370) Área de Autocaravanas Deleitosa
description: It is a new area with column payment with gray water emptying, clean water intake and electricity. Next to the pools in summer. It is a town located very close to Trujillo, Monfragüe and Guadalupe Natural Park. Good town to rest and taste good products from Extremadura at a good price. To enter with a motorhome, follow the fork that indicates prohibited except for trucks and motorhomes (the one on the left side, the other is very narrow and it is difficult to pass).

title: (10360) Casas de Miravete - EX-386
description: It's a very large car park and is far enough from the highway that traffic noise, gas station and bar are open 24 hours a day.

title: (10370) Deleitosa - 20 EX-386
description: 2 picnic tables, beautiful views of the village of Deleitosa and the surrounding mountains, in the shade of cork oaks.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Shaded parking at the edge of the road. Great motorhome without worries. No service.

title: (10184) -
description: Beautiful place in the middle of nature, do not stay overnight, narrow path but with caution you can get there, there are picnic areas, without containers or water, free, very beautiful place, I just ask that it be just as clean

title: (10360) Casas de Miravete - Camino Cementerio
description: Charming space on the side of a road next to a picnic area with a fountain. Near the village. No one passes through there except those who work nearby farms. We spend the night with a big van without any problem.

title: (10134) Campo Lugar - camino olivares
description: Dear friends, welcome to Huerta los Hermanos! What kind of services and possibilities can you expect: Fresh water, hiking, biking, nature, swimming in one of the 2 nearby lakes, shopping in the village, lots of birds for birdwatchers or just to listen and watch. Sites to visit: Castle of Medellin, capital of Miajadas tomatoes, old town of Trujillo. Once you arrive in Campo Lugar, there are 2 ways to get to our land. 1. a gravel road with lots of potholes or 2. a good road through the village. If your vehicle can't make the sharp left turn, go straight, you'll get to us anyway.

title: (10360) Casas de Miravete - 11 Travesia Guadiana
description: Petit coin d'herbe dans un village très calme. parfait pour faire une pause sur la route entre Madrid et seville

title: (10183) Torrequemada - 47 Calle Ejido
description: A spacious, quiet place with good access, next to a pond called the lower pond and a small playground with games. Several bars at the entrance and another very famous for its spectacular suckling pigs in the center of town. It is very interesting to visit the Ermita del Salor and Las Corralás on foot. The town is very quiet and the people are hospitable.

title: (10194) Monroy -
description: At first I parked at the hermitage but that area is obviously used extensively by the local fishermen and probably weekend drinking- continued along the dirt track through the gate which could easily fit my van - plenty of shade just have to pick your place and move with the sun ! Nice walk around the lake with plenty of birds

title: (10194) Monroy - C. Doña Carmen González
description: Water tap at back of hermitage

title: (10373) Cabañas del Castillo - CC-22.1
description: A place near the town Cabañas del Castillo, it is a fairly level parking lot, next to a wooden table and chair. It is worth a visit to the castle, a path leaves about 100m d here, which takes you along a very pleasant path.

title: (10373) Cabañas del Castillo - CC-22.1
description: Picnic area with good views. Trees that provide shade. Source. The parking lot is quite large but there are not many very flat spots. We haven't slept so we don't know how quiet it is at night but it is next to a road that doesn't seem very busy. Climbing area 5 minutes by car, in castle cabins, where you can also take a walk to go up to the castle (15 min uphill from the town). Note that in castle cabins there are no shops or bars.

title: (10373) Cabañas del Castillo - CC-22.1
description: Large esplanade next to the road, but very quiet. Completely leveled (I think it is only used to place portable arenas during village festivities). Very beautiful views. Without service. The village of Cabañas del Castillo is small and picturesque, and the spectacular landscape, highlighted by the climbing areas.

title: (10133) Escurial - 22 Poligono Quince
description: Located next to BP gas station. Ability to connect, and there is a restaurant, WC and showers.

title: (10194) Monroy - 3 Calle Tálamo
description: Esplanade in an old silo at the entrance of the village. Five minutes from the square, from the town hall. You can visit the Church of Saint Catherine (XVI century) and the castle

title: (10187) Albalá - Carretera a Albalá del Cau
title_short: (10187) Albalá - Carretera a Albalá del Cau
description: Place away from the village. With toilets, showers and fountain. Picnic tables and barbecue. Avoid romerias. Resurrection Sunday and first Sunday of May. Very calm. Place of concentration of caravans and motorhomes once a year

title: (10359) Romangordo - 183P Diseminado Atajo Huerta Rincon
description: Wide street with little slope where to park the AC and visit the picturesque town. Entrance to the street with inclination. To spend the day or the night (without hindering the gates of the farms)

title: (10359) Romangordo - 30 Calle Retamar
description: Beautiful area with parking, barbecue and fountain at the entrance of the village of Romangordo. Nice view and you can go hiking.

title: (10133) Escurial - 1 EX-102
description: Small parking lot in the village next to a little traffic road near a pond. No service. Attention GPS! From the north do not take the road through the village Escurial (too narrow streets) but drive to Miajadas and turn left there.

title: (10133) Escurial - 132 Poligono Quinientos Uno
description: Parking at the village exit. View of the hills. Children's playground. No service. Attention GPS! From the north do not take the road through the village Escurial (too narrow streets) but drive to Miajadas and turn left there.

title: (10359) Romangordo - 10 Calle Carretera
description: Trouble-free parking on the outskirts of Romangordo, famous for its murals and trompe l'oeil. Very quiet and uncrowded area next to a small park, with three picnic tables.

title: (10359) Romangordo -
description: Picnic area on the outskirts of Romanogordo, lots of space at the back, is next to the road, but it is not very busy. pretty even.

title: (10359) Romangordo - CC-34.1
description: Picnic area next to the town of Romangordo ... the town of trompe-l'oeil, in the eastern part of Monfragüe National Park.

title: (10373) Roturas - De Navazuelas - Retamosa
description: Picnic area with tables with benches under a shade roof, 7 fixed umbrellas, rubbish bins and an area for bathing. About 6 seats for cars (or 2 for a motorhome).

name: Camper stop Alegria
title: (10170) Camper stop Alegria
description: The motorhome area is easy to access. There are 20 spacious plots, we are located a very short distance from the center of Montánchez, a very special little town, located in the heart of Extremadura and known in Spain for its delicious Iberian ham. Montánchez also offers a very well preserved castle, dating from Roman times, located next to one of the most beautiful cemeteries in Spain. Due to its location at an altitude of 700 meters, it offers spectacular views of the landscape, which is why it is also known as the "Balcony of Extremadura". For more information, see the website

title: (10004) Sierra de Fuentes -
description: On the other side of the lake by the fairly correct dirt track, perfect spot for calm, the view, the setting sun and the very beautiful nature at the beginning of spring, it feels a bit like being in Ireland!!

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Parking to spend the night on the edge of Monfrague park where camping is prohibited. Calm. Slightly sloping. Located at the exit of the city.

title: (10170) Montánchez - Extrarradio Rivera Robledo
description: New newly paved parking lots. At the top they are more level. On the outskirts of the town in a very quiet place.

title: (10100) Miajadas - 2A Calle Martires
description: Parking in an access street to a new subdivision, directly overlooking the Martyrs' park, with palm trees and very pleasant lawns. Rare and calm traffic guaranteed ...

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - 25 Diseminado Barrio Corchito
title_short: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - 25 Diseminado Barrio Corchito
description: Next to the sports area of the municipality. Next to the wall of the pool it is very inclined, but in the green area that overlooks the football field it is good. There are no services but you are at the end of the town, so there will be places to buy bread or food. Very quiet night. Thanks to the municipality for allowing parking and spending the night (not camping).

title: (10181) Sierra de Fuentes - Unnamed Road
description: Small parking lot at a hermit. Good for an overnight stay. Great prospects ...

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place by the lake in a quiet area with a beautiful view of the lake, no garbage cans, no services very clean places, a few cyclists and walkers during the day, after the dam there is a small climb which is not in very good condition not recommended in a motorhome and low vehicle, I went there with a 6m van no problem

title: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa - CC-19.5
description: Small viewpoint next to a little traveled road. Incredible views of Los Ibores and starting point for the most seasoned to visit the Juncaldilla Cave. place is amazing to sleep, hardly any cars pass.

title: (10170) Montánchez - 16 Calle Juan Carlos I
description: In Montánchez (Cáceres), small area where you can park 2 motorhomes.

title: (10187) Albalá - 40 Calle Víctor Celestino Borreguero
description: Very quiet area Asphalted. Level and with beautiful views.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio -
description: This car park is inside the royal ravine of Torrejón el Rubio, a resting place for transhumant animals, perfect nights, to rest without noise (if the sheep are not there) and to see the stars and planets, with the astronomer Carlos, at night, very Well explained, from the South Visitor Center of Monfragüe, what is next. Yes, the door is closed, you can enter, park and the door will be left as it was. You can make routes to the Monfragüe natural reserve, before you have to go to the reserve office, which is in the town. According to all the Vilatans asked, yes, it is allowed to spend the day and the night; the answers, it is always the same, it is allowed. The cemetery parking lot is far from the town.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: On old piece of road and / or former park area, behind the hedge separating it from the road, beautiful view, due west. For van or small motorhome

title: (10004) Cáceres -
description: Place next to the Guadiloba reservoir. There is no type of service but it is a quiet place next to the water. Overhang next to the road. Level.

title: (10004) (Campus Universitario) - Unnamed Road
description: Magnificent spot at the water's edge of the dam. The view is superb on the lake and the steppe-type landscape! Absolute silence flat and stable ground.

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description:
By a water reservoir. Peaceful and wonderful views, especially for bird watchers!  Okay only wifi wise. Easy access for all during the dry months.

Keep it clean, thank you.

title: (10187) Albalá - 8 Calle Donantes de Sangre
description: Wide parking inside the village. With good access. No services, although there is a fountain nearby. Wifi of the house of culture (pass: library). Commerce nearby and three bars where you can eat. There are marked routes. The town is very quiet and hospitable people. It is not tourist, but it is the typical town in the middle of the pasture of Extremadura. Avoid during the festivities of the carnivals.

title: (10181) Sierra de Fuentes - N-521
description: Rest area.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: We spent a weekend here in May. Lots of space and several options for parking. A couple of fishermen here for the day, and a shepherd walking by with his flock. Lots of herons, storks and ducks. Very peaceful. Tracks in quite good repair and a large waste bin so not to much litter around. No problems with our 7m sprinter van.

title: (10170) Montánchez - 1F Calle Floreta
description: Parking by the pool, at the starting point of hiking routes. completely flat and very quiet.

title: (10170) Montánchez - 24 Calle Taramilla
description: Very calm in the park of the very calm village. Must try Iberian ham is excellent

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - Calle Calvo Sotelo
title_short: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - Calle Calvo Sotelo
description: Cemetery parking, water available at the tap inside. Ideal for the Monfragüe park

title: (10004) Cáceres - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in service near a restaurant and overlooking the dam Guadiloba. We made a picnic stop .. very calm .. possibility of spending the night. a pedestrian path allows the tower of the dam.

title: (10187) Albalá - 363 Diseminado Poligono 1 Numero
description: In ALbala, Place in beaten ground behind the hall of the village. Very calm place. Fountain to fill up with water.

title: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa -
description: A place where you can stop to eat and have a shade, we passed by here on the way to the natural pool Las Pilatillas and we stopped to eat before arriving, it is just after the roundabout on the left.

title: (10132) Almoharín - 16 Calle UE-9
description: Parking in Almoharín. Famous place for its chocolate figs. The gray and black water can be emptied and it has 6 water intakes on the ground, under iron covers. The intakes are prepared for wide hoses. Very close to the Visigoth Basilica of Santa Lucía del Trampal. And also near the Sierra de Montánchez where the thousand-year-old oak La Terrona is located.

title: (10359) Romangordo - N-V
description: Nice place where you can rest near the lake. Currently too much green algae I have not bathed.

title: (10100) Miajadas - EX-106
description: Parking at the sports center. Next to swimming pool. Small lake. No service. Quiet in the off season.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Concrete area between 4 olive trees. Great view of the somewhat dry lake. In the morning a flock of sheep came by. In sight is a neighbor with dogs barking in greeting ...

title: (10120) Logrosán - Avenida de la Constitución
description: Quiet picnic at the end green lane

title: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa - 5D Calle Luis Canalejo
title_short: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa - 5D Calle Luis Canalejo
description: Very cozy village with a single bar that makes homemade meals very rich. Exceptional hiking trails, especially the aqueduct and blacksmithing. Wifi in the bar of the town (also comes from the square), water in the fountain of the plaza de los pilones, bakery and other groceries in the village store. Everything less than 2 min walk.

title: (10100) Miajadas - 39 Calle Beethoven
description: Large parking outside my city Miajadas. Very calm night no problem.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Fantastic and wonderful view of the lake! complete silence, many storks and herons, only to hear the bells of the sheep in the distance. One of our favorite places.

title: (10129) Berzocana -
description: Beautiful place near beginner climbing spot (grade 4)

title: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa - 2 Calle Carretera de Valdecañas
title_short: (10329) Campillo de Deleitosa - 2 Calle Carretera de Valdecañas
description: Town Hall Square. We do not sleep here but next to the soccer field at the entrance of the town. The experience in this town has been spectacular. The neighbors help you with everything, they give you fruit, they talk and say hello at all times. The visit to the aqueduct is very cool. We have dinner in the village bar , home of the pensioner , from 21:00 the kitchen is open . Some delicious hamburgers and croquettes too, very friendly owners. Come and dine here. Unbeatable everything. Thank you.

title: (10359) Romangordo - N-V
description: Very spacious place to spend the night and even enjoy nature. There are some abandoned buildings and the river to fish or bathe. good sunsets. the access road is short but dirt, do not access where it says the Maps, get on the main road and go down next to the house

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Nice place to spend the night

title: (10120) Logrosán - 11 Carretera Guadalupe
description: Public parking inside the Constanza mine. It's inside the geological museum. The workers told us that you could spend the night. Do not forget to visit the mines, by appointment, there is a water tap. It seems like a very good place to sleep. We went to the town area and slept in the polygon because you can't sleep there, but if we had known about this place we would have come here without hesitation. The spaces are for cars but motorhomes fit perfectly. Day supermarket down the same street a few minutes.

title: (10329) Valdecañas de Tajo - Calle Enrique Tierno Galván
title_short: (10329) Valdecañas de Tajo - Calle Enrique Tierno Galván
description: Dam in summer forms a natural pool with river water! Good shade in the pools, bar and wc!

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Good place to spend the night, I traveled to Huelva for the night, some more van. many places in the shade and no people. the bad if you turn on moskitos light at night. normal in places with water

title: (10132) Almoharín -
description: "Natural paradise of Kiko cosquilla" In our space: we are free from extremes, we share, we respect each other, we laugh, we sunbathe, we read, we tell each other stories, an incubator of ideas, we enjoy the sunset and above all we love the earth and nature. What we try to do is create a confluence place for conscientious and daring people. We have our hens that are the queens of the space, orchard, wonderful shadows, barbecue, puff, hammocks... We also have accommodation with two rooms and a super cute caravan. Location: We are in the center of Extremadura in a rural environment 5 km from our town "Almoharin" where figs and fig bonbons are our star product. Neighbors of Montanchez with a ham that takes your mind away. We can also enjoy our cities just 30 minutes from Mérida, Trujillo and Cáceres. *We do breakfast on weekends. *Natural breads with slow fermentation (by order) *Eggs from our hens in freedom. *Figs. *box of assorted vegetables. If you want to share, respect and feel at peace you are WELCOME.

name: Domaine de Logrosan El Palomar
title: (10120) Domaine de Logrosan El Palomar
description: Next to the silo. Limited to 48 hours. Potable water. Emptying of gray water. Emptying of waste water. Picnic area. Restaurants and cafes 100 m. Supermarket at 1000 meters.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Around the idyllic little dam there are numerous parking spaces on the shore under eucalyptus trees with great views of the lake. Very quiet. At the beginning of June there hardly seems to be anyone here. A couple of fishermen can be made out. Recommendable

title: (10350) Almaraz -
description: Magnificent place at the historical bridge puenta de aldalat, a few meters above the water, quiet, because little traffic. Eagle, bird paradise. Solid, almost completely level ground. Recommended . 1km further in the direction of the lake, several places, some directly on the water, several driveways. See there for a more detailed description.

title: (10164) Urbanización Zamarrilla -
description: Paradisiacal place in the middle of nature

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: Location of an old leisure center. The tables and benches are there, but in very bad condition. It seems to me possible to sleep there, but it's isolated.

title: (10164) Cáceres - CC-142
description: At the edge of a pretty, super-quiet lake. Magnificent rocks, a quiet place, bird sanctuary.

title: (10350) Almaraz - km. 200 Autovía de Extremadura
description: Almaraz Motorhome area. filling and emptying. ideal to stop en route

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Place in the countryside, at the edge of a small river. Very quiet at night, some cars pass on the bridge (200 meters) from time to time. Otherwise, there is only the sound of water and the singing of frogs. Access by a steep stony path that is (may be) impressive for some vehicles but is done quite. Wedges could be a plus.

title: (10528) Serrejón - 2 Calle Pilar
description: Park equipped with picnic tables, where you can enjoy your snack.

title: (10528) Serrejón - 16 Calle Prado
description:
Parking with 20 parking spaces, for caravans, motorhomes and campers.
FREE.

Drinking water, gray and black water.
Petanque courts.

Unbeatable area in the heart of the Biosphere Reserve, Monfragüe National Park.
Located between meadows of holm oaks and cork oaks, and views of the mountains of La Herguijuela, La Urraca and La Parrilla.

You can walk through this beautiful town, while enjoying nature in all its splendor. The routes can be seen in the Wikiloc application.
At about 300 meters there is a paddle tennis court.

To access the car park, you must fill out a registration form.

title: (10340) Castañar de Ibor - EX-386
description: Place in the middle of nature next to a river where you can cool off. We spent a night here with no problem. The setting is fantastic. The road is right next door, although there is almost no traffic. There is no shade.

title: (10110) Madrigalejo - Vias Verdes de Las Vegas del Guadiana y las Villuercas
title_short: (10110) Madrigalejo - Vias Verdes de Las Vegas del Guadiana y las Villuercas
description: Madrigalejo old train station. Quiet place with swings, a fountain and 3 km from the town where there are all services. The old train track is now a beautiful greenway.

address.street: Vias Verdes de Las Vegas del Guadiana y las Villuercas

title: (10110) Barrio de San Juan - EX-355
description:
Picnic spot along cycle route Vias
 verde. no amenities. from here you can follow route south and north. bike path in reasonable condition.

do not leave traces of waste or dirty water as a thank you for the stay!

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Small parking for up to two vehicles right by the main road going through the park. It is just outside the park so it is not forbidden to overnight there. Traffic noise at night as it is very close to the road. Nothing to do around. No walking possibilities.

title: (10161) Arroyomolinos - CC-117
description: It is a picnic area with tables, under some trees that provide shade. and next to a pond with ducks. It is just at the edge of the Sierra de Montanchez. As a negative point, it is that it is close to the road. Although it is not very busy.

title: (10003) Cáceres - 52 Sierra de la Montaña
description: It is the highest point in the city, nobody bothers you at night and in the morning. We stayed two nights and it is a good place with stunning views of Cáceres.

title: (10003) Cáceres - Ctra de la Montaña
description: Place with beautiful views of the city, close to the city. We have spent a very quiet night, there are usually almost no cars. It is uphill, for us it has not been a problem.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 13 Calle Juan Ramón Marchena
description: Quiet residential area to spend the night. Nearby urban bus stops. Easy access. Good incorporation to motorways. They take motorhomes of any size. Nearby playgrounds

title: (10005) Cáceres - N-630
description: Motorway rest area (without services - only drinking water) Gasoil, LPG, Water, Tire pressure, Small grocery store, Parking to be shared with heavy goods vehicles, Restaurant correct for the place. Good for a night on the (Madison) road to Algedira.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 14 Avenida de la Universidad
description: Auto gas LPG

description: Water filling fountain (with push button). It is also possible to park since it is a residential area and is very quiet.

title_short: (10164) Valdesalor (Cáceres) - Puente Viejo de la Mocha
description: Vast meadow spreading around el puente viejo of Mocha. A peaceful night of March. Picnic area, water, ornithological observatories...

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208
description: Ground parking at the base of the castle Natural Park Monfrague. Forbidden to sleep at night.

title: (10003) Cáceres - 13a Carretera de la Montaña
description: Parking for 5 or 6 cc on a slope 12 minutes from the city center by walking. Garbage cans available and a nice view of the old town. The cleanliness is not there but it is clearly that the other car parks located 20 minutes from the plaza mayor.

title: (10004) Cáceres - 2 Avenida de la Universidad

description:
Along the Vias verde cycle route.

no facilities but very quiet. enjoy the place, cycle or walk and leave nothing behind, no dirt, no toilet or the like! then these places will remain available.

description: Near downtown, bus stops, shops and restaurants. Quiet during the night.

description: Nearby supermarket Maxi Dia, gas station, Health Center. Quiet place and with nearby bus stops.

title: (10341) Navalvillar de Ibor - EX-118

description: On the way near the lake, beautiful and with trees.

title: (10694) Torrejón el Rubio - EX-208

title: (10140) -

description: Great parking next to the road and the river and with covered picnic areas where you can enjoy the wonderful views.

title: (10136) Cañamero - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful spot on a headland of the Cañamero reservoir. Sun and shade all day long from two trees. Only accessible for 4x4.

title: (10136) Cañamero - Unnamed Road
description: Location in a curve at the edge of the track. Suitable for a van or very small camper. Superb view. Very calm place. just the passage of some fishermen and walkers in the late afternoon. Very relaxing night. Continue the track after the dam.

title: (10136) Cañamero - Calle Pablo García Garrido
description: Parking on the ground, quite flat, next to the Charco de la Nutria, in a very beautiful and calm natural environment. Access by dirt road in the correct state. El Charco de la Nutria is a wide and deep natural basin of the cold waters of the Ruecas River. It is also about 200 meters from Cueva Chiquita, with rock paintings. Climbing routes Garbage cans and wooden tables on the bank. About 200 m downstream there is a natural swimming pool. No type of services; the city is about 2 km.

title: (10136) Cañamero - CC-21.3
description: Parking by the pool, ideal for spending the night.

title: (10136) Cañamero - Unnamed Road
description: Super nice by a lake, several other locations around it. Some mosquitoes but not very aggressive ... Quiet night.

description: Picnic air at bord de route avec fontaine et des tables pour manger. Ombragé.

title: (10136) Cañamero - CC-21.1
description: Beautiful shaded corner. 1 km from the natural swimming pool La Nutria and the caves with rock paintings

title: (10163) Aldea del Cano - 3 Calle Carretera
description: It has no service. We spent the night very quiet and ate in the bar, by the way we ate very well.

title: (10136) Cañamero - Calle Pablo García Garrido
description: Quiet place, parking day and night, to spend the night without noise and in nature, large area for large motorhome or campers. It has flat areas. eye! respect the agricultural ford of the building. 800 m to Cueva Chiquita and Charco de la nutria, and another natural pool. Both have a picnic area and rubbish bins.

description: It is a gas station where you can park and sleep. Much noise from the continuous coming and going of vehicles. There is a 24-hour cafeteria and a shop. It is near a town.

title: (10591) Toril - Unnamed Road
description: Nice views of the river. Parking is precarious on a small sloping shoulder next to the road

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road
description: Ample parking behind the municipal swimming pools. Very calm. On the way to the pre-Romanesque church of Santa Lucía del Trampal, about 3 km away, which deserves a visit. Trash and glass containers.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - 2 Calle Natividad Gabriel
description: A wide and very quiet street in the town of Alcuéscar in Cáceres.

title: (10193) Talaván - 18 Calle Lavaderos
description: Talavan The place is next to some old laundries, called La Breña. There is fresh water and shops and bars nearby. The town has things to see and if you want to walk a path goes up to the Tagus, there is a hermitage and it takes about 40 '. You can also go with the car.

title: (10350) Almaraz -
description: Gas station with store, garbage can and bar nearby, large parking lot, many roofs. Quiet and secluded and at the same time a step away from the highway

title: (10193) Talaván - 1 Camino Piscinas
description: Public parking. Pool side with bar / terrace and bathrooms. Typical Extremadura village. Church of the XV century and hermitage next to the pit. Old laundry room with super cool water

title: (10530) Serradilla -
description: Quiet place next to the road. Fit one or two vans or motorhomes. Access is by unpaved road but in good condition. We spent two very quiet nights, there are a couple of stone tables next to it to eat, and it is very close to the viewpoint and the gorge of the friar. IMPORTANT To avoid going through the gate, it is better to go along the cemetery road. We with an L3H2 passed without problems. There is a small descent, which is carefully passed. Perhaps somewhat complicated for motorhomes.

title: (10530) Serradilla -
description: Magnificent and secluded location facing Monfraguë Park. There are 3 stone tables and a shaded shelter. Possible to park in the middle for a car, quite steep passage. Otherwise two places just before on the roadside. There is no shortage of trash cans, we clean the site when we leave, keep it clean!! No wind as we passed despite the exposure.

title: (10695) Villarreal de San Carlos -
description: Sunny place to take a break or more.

title: (10695) Serradilla - EX-208
description: Parking space, beautiful hiking trails.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Unnamed Road
description: Perfect place to spend the night with a magnificent viewpoint. Place with little shade for summer.

title: (10162) Casas de Don Antonio -
description: Newly installed spot outside of the village. Garbage cans behind the tennis court. Great basketball court, swimming pool (outdoor pool) in sight. Only drinking water, do not use the tap for the chemical toilets, transmission of faecal germs!

title: (10394) Belvís de Monroy -
description: Beautiful picnic in a unique environment, surrounded by incredible landscapes to the Tagus river from the Hermitage of Berrocal, with pedestrian access just 3min from the Franciscan convent that twinned this wonderful town with Huetjozcingo (Mexico) after colonization. All this is located just 1km from the town center, in which stands an impressive medieval castle. a very quiet and very quiet place to sleep, in turn surrounded by other places where parking is possible for this purpose, for example parking of the municipal pool among others.

title: (10530) Serradilla - Carretera Torrejón el Rubio
description: Parking next to the road. Illuminated. Bar-Restaurant, nearby.

title: (10390) Saucedilla -
description: New motorhome area with access to water and electricity on an individual pitch. 4 places. Next to the Ornithological Park of Arrocampo (100% recommended, super careful). Drinking water and electricity services are not yet operational (they will be chargeable). It is possible to empty gray water

title: (10390) Saucedilla - CC-17.1
description: It is allowed to park and spend the night in front of the information kiosk of the bird park. Very popular with foreign motorhomes in the spring for bird photos. Behind the stand there are picnic benches, in the stand there is an employee of the town hall for any questions. There are public toilets and 300m away there is a supermarket which opens on weekends. Safe place to sleep.

title: (10530) Serradilla - Unnamed Road
description: Small esplanade next to a dirt road, quiet to spend the night. No services. Near the sculpture of the wolf.

title: (10530) Serradilla - 101 Calle Álamo
description: Close to shops, bars, Health Center, Interpretation Center and Guardia Civil Barracks. Quiet.

title: (06410) Conquista del Guadiana - 15 Ronda Extremadura
description: Ideal place for a stop, just off the A5 motorway. At the entrance of the town, good access and easy. Not highly recommended to spend the night because of the noise of the motorway. Without services, just a small fountain to drink.

title: (06410) Conquista del Guadiana - 13 Calle Nicaragua
description: Large quiet area with trees (nowadays they are long and paved streets), a very good area to rest during the day and especially at night without noise, without deviating much from the highway but at the same time from which you cannot hear a car .. the birds wake you up. It is a small town where you have bread, parks for children and pets.

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - Cordel de Mérida s/n
description: Campsite motorhome. max. number of places: 8 | max. camper length: 8m | max. length of stay: 3 weeks| Open: 1/1 - 31/12. price: - electricity, loading unloading waste water, washing machine, drinking water, wifi available at reception for a fee - call in advance - village 3km - close to the A66 exit 590. approach via the EX382 via Cordel de Mérida, Red gravel road entrance at wood company with yellow fences, after 900 meters on the cordel de Merida motorhome La Tierra Verde Holiday Accommodations

title: (10160) Alcuéscar - EX-382
description: National Highway 630- km.591, 10160 Alcuéscar. Next to the Repsol gas station. Good place to spend the night, Hostal Restaurante LOS OLIVOS, good food, shower. Ask Julio, good people.

title: (10394) Belvís de Monroy - 585 N-Va
description: Valcarce gas station, very friendly staff, parking for the night on the right when you arrive with emptying of gray water, quite quiet for a station, filling of water (not drinkable) and emptying of black water on the right side of the station (see photo) behind the bins and next to the shower. restaurant/café day

title: (06715) Rena - Ctra. de Palazuelo
description:
Nice location at abandoned train station (ruin)

part of via verde del guadiana

title: (10521) Toril - 2 Plaza de España
description: Small but very nice town near the Monfragüe National Park. Possibility of walking or cycling routes. Very well equipped recreation area. It has a bar where you can have a coffee or a snack.

title: (10521) Toril - 7 Plaza de España
description: Slightly different location than already shown. In front of the bar to have a coffee or any other drink. On the edge of the Monfraigue Biosphere Reserve. Quiet, you only hear the birds.

title: (10530) Serradilla - CCV-29
description: New pull off to view over the surrounding countryside- next to road with some level area - fantastic view but don’t get too close to the edge with vehicles as chippings are still soft - probably ok for night but good for mid day stop as does have shade

title: (06412) Hernán Cortes - Unnamed Road
description: Hernán Cortes public picnic area. Green area. Quiet parking.

title: (10520) Casatejada - 28 Avenida de la Constitución
description: Public car park without service. Quiet night and relatively flat parking lot.

title: (06711) Gargaligas - 36 Ronda del Sur
description: Parking in the pool, flat, illuminated, quiet. (between Ciudad Real and Mérida we couldn't find any other) Swimming pool parking, flat, illuminated, and quiet.

title: (10529) Majadas - CC-152
description: When we take this highway few places indicated on the site. So we stopped here! Calm few trucks, in addition we managed side cars to be quiet. No noise from the highway even the windows open. Ideal to rest without detours.

title: (10680) Malpartida de Plasencia - EX-208
description: Quiet spot, surrounded by nature. Very nice view to the mountain top far away. There's the occasional car passing by (it's on a side road that leads to a hotel) and it's also close to the main road, although there's so little traffic you couldnt tell. It's conveniently close to Monfrague natural park. Overnight NOT allowed!

title: (06410) Santa Amalia -
description: Simple recreational area on the banks of the Rio Burdalo with flat places in the shade or not. Road with little traffic during the day and very quiet at night. Very good for spending the night.

title: (10520) Casatejada -
description: Departure of hike with picnic tables and a source in an oak grove, near a water point. Place in the nature very quiet and pleasant...

title: (06412) Don Benito - EX-106
description: Spectacular site with shadow and large river where you can bathe very deep, we did not spend the night but we had lunch and nobody appeared a children's park next door and where to vote garbage. surrounded by fairly tall eucalyptus trees

title: (06410) Santa Amalia - 71 Calle la Cruz
description: Free parking
